title: killjoy223
author: killjoy223
content: Hey, guys. I'm writing to appeal that I can't choose a good cryptocurrency exchanger with minimal fees. I'm waiting for your answers!

comments.author: Nrcewker
comments.body: Quote from: killjoy223 on December 13, 2022, 11:35:16 AMHey, guys. I'm writing to appeal that I can't choose a good cryptocurrency exchanger with minimal fees. I'm waiting for your answers! What do you exactly define as fees? It’s always great to choose exchanges which have trust and reputation. If you go after minimal fees and choose a new yet unpopular exchange, and if they later on scam attempt on you, then you won’t be left with choices, as your whole money will be lost by that time. So I would always suggest you to go for the exchanges, which are there in this market for atleast 4 years. Best exchange according to me will be Binance and Kucoin. Rest is upto you OP.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Check this list for your convenience --> https://coinmarketfees.com/exchangesThere's the taker and maker's fee so you can decide which of them is charging less. But regardless of the fee, I'm sure that many of us here will suggest to you Binance and other top exchanges.Another thing, this topic IMHO should be in Exchanges --> https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=223.0

comments.author: Bobrox
comments.body: If you are looking for with minimal fees trading I think Binance is the best option exchange market for your choosing, trade there with BUSD pair and use limit order between selling and buying without have to pay fees yet. But if you mean about withdrawing fees all exchange have the same fees withdrawing at altcoin or Bitcoin. Binance have support with P2P and you can convert or withdraw your stable coins assets like BUSD or USDT to be fiat and withdrawing directly to your Bank account without any fees.Before FTX collapse exactly the most cheapest fees exchange for withdrawing our assets, there are not have to pay fees yet when withdrawing at FTX, but right now this exchange have been indicate as scam exchange market and I don't sure have other exchange market without paying fees like FTX.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: killjoy223 on December 13, 2022, 11:35:16 AMHey, guys. I'm writing to appeal that I can't choose a good cryptocurrency exchanger with minimal fees. I'm waiting for your answers! If you are afraid of fees then you have no much clues  about the system. You would be looking or wanting recommendations for less fee exchange and get into the wrong ones which are unpopular and new in existence. If they scam you, your assets together with your funds are all gone. So I will advise you to go do your own research on long existing exchange with good reputation from the masses and verified on coin market cap with huge daily trading volume. With this, you are guaranteed of your funds being safe for trading. But you should remember that " not your keys, not your coin" still stands. The transaction fee should not be an issue rather the safety of your assets and funds should be your priorities.

comments.author: DaniBlur
comments.body: Quote from: killjoy223 on December 13, 2022, 11:35:16 AMHey, guys. I'm writing to appeal that I can't choose a good cryptocurrency exchanger with minimal fees. I'm waiting for your answers! Hello, from my personal experience I can recommend such a young site as https://crypocto.com/, very cool support around the clock, low commissions, and high places in the top on BestChange

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Are you talking about trading fees?Why not use Binance exchange trading USDT, BTC and ETH is free with no trading fees except on other coins.Or you might be talking about withdrawal fees? Which depends on what coin you are going to withdraw Binance is a bit expensive around $3 when withdrawing BTC but you can get a cheap fee if you withdraw BTC on another network like Bep20. Or reduce few by exchanging BTC to other coins with very cheap withdrawal fee.Check binance withdrawal fee here https://www.binance.com/en/fee/cryptoFee

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: DaniBlur on December 13, 2022, 01:03:08 PMHello, from my personal experience I can recommend such a young site as xxxxxx, very cool support around the clock, low commissions...A newbie asks, and after 2 hours another newbie with a fresh account answers advertising something that should be an appropriate answer? You have to make a little more effort if you want to leave a serious impression that something you are promoting is really worth it - I will certainly not make an account there and check whether you are telling the truth or if it is just one of a series of scams.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Quote from: boyptc on December 13, 2022, 12:49:07 PMCheck this list for your convenience --> https://coinmarketfees.com/exchangesThis list is already outdated since there's FTX included on the list while it's already bankrupt.I advice to not choose the exchange because of the fees only, it's useless if you pick an exchange that offer small or free trading fee but the exchange has many accusations or scam. You need to take consideration about the reputation, trading pairs, listed coins, minimum withdrawal, withdrawal fee etc. Based on the list, it seems Bybit is the best option if you can take a risk, if you can't take a risk you can choose Binance.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: boyptc on December 13, 2022, 12:49:07 PM-snip-There's the taker and maker's fee so you can decide which of them is charging less. But regardless of the fee, I'm sure that many of us here will suggest to you Binance and other top exchanges.I think the OP wanted some advice for instant exchanges that funding would go straight to personal wallet, trading exchanges like Binance will charge withdrawal fees as well which is generally 3 to 10 times more than what the network itself charges.OSS has made a great list of instant exchangers. Please check here, @OP.

comments.author: Getmon
comments.body: Do exchange trading and withdrawal fees differ significantly? They appear to be similar. We are aware that exchanges can also defraud us or declare bankruptcy. In any case, the smaller the exchange, the higher the gamble of not being able to absorb misfortunes from various problems and issues that can happen from here on out. I would prefer to trade on the most trustworthy exchanges rather than one with lower fees but unproven. It ought to be an exchange with good volume and more markets to I can choose to trade.   An updated ranking of exchanges based on trading volume and ratings is provided here.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Quote from: Plaguedeath on December 13, 2022, 01:47:05 PMQuote from: boyptc on December 13, 2022, 12:49:07 PMCheck this list for your convenience --> https://coinmarketfees.com/exchangesThis list is already outdated since there's FTX included on the list while it's already bankrupt.I advice to not choose the exchange because of the fees only, it's useless if you pick an exchange that offer small or free trading fee but the exchange has many accusations or scam. You need to take consideration about the reputation, trading pairs, listed coins, minimum withdrawal, withdrawal fee etc. Based on the list, it seems Bybit is the best option if you can take a risk, if you can't take a risk you can choose Binance.He just can remove it and ignore if it's just all about FTX. I've just given the list for him to have an idea how much fees the other has.I agree to you that just because of the fees, it shouldn't just be his standard for choosing but the satisfaction of most users that it has got.Quote from: noorman0 on December 13, 2022, 02:30:11 PMQuote from: boyptc on December 13, 2022, 12:49:07 PM-snip-There's the taker and maker's fee so you can decide which of them is charging less. But regardless of the fee, I'm sure that many of us here will suggest to you Binance and other top exchanges.I think the OP wanted some advice for instant exchanges that funding would go straight to personal wallet, trading exchanges like Binance will charge withdrawal fees as well which is generally 3 to 10 times more than what the network itself charges.OSS has made a great list of instant exchangers. Please check here, @OP.Well, I don't know about that, he can basically go to the typical instant exchanges like fixedfloat, changelly and the others.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: killjoy223 on December 13, 2022, 11:35:16 AMHey, guys. I'm writing to appeal that I can't choose a good cryptocurrency exchanger with minimal fees. I'm waiting for your answers! You can use Bestchange (Link in my signature,) it has a wide range of platforms in which you will find the cheapest fees and a comparison between many platforms according to what you want, but it is better and before using any platform: - Do your own research and have an in-depth research. - Avoid any platform with unknown information. - Ask about it here in the forum.So I guarantee you that you will get the lowest fees.Also, the type of cryptocurrencies you want to convert plays a crucial criterion, as some currencies are not listed on some platforms.
